model

Class Person

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.Person
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Librarian, User

    public abstract class Person
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a person from which both the user and librarian classes are inherited from. It holds all the standard information to create a profile.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Charles Day

              java.lang.String postcode,
              java.lang.String avatarPath)
        Creates a new Person object from the given arguments.
        Parameters:
        username - The user name of this person.
        firstName - First Name of this person.
        lastName - Last name of this person.
        phoneNumber - Phone number of this person.
        address - Address of this person.
        postcode - Post code of this person.
        avatarPath - Path to the avatar image of this person.

        public static Person loadPerson(java.lang.String userName)
        Loads up a user or librarian from the database and returnes them casted as a Person.
        Parameters:
        userName - The user name of the person we want to load.
        Returns:
        either a librarian or a user from the database.

      • updateDatabase

        protected static boolean updateDatabase(java.lang.String table,
                                        java.lang.String username,
                                        java.lang.String column,
                                        java.lang.String data)
        Method that updates the table in the database specified, at the row with given username, and at the given column.
        Parameters:
        table - The table where the change needs to be made.
        username - The user name that needs to be updated.
        column - The name of the field that will be updated.
        data - The new value of the field.
        Returns:
        True if the database updates and false if it does not

      • removePerson

        public static boolean removePerson(java.lang.String username)
        Removes the user from the database.
        Parameters:
        username - The username of the user to remove.
        Returns:
        True if it as removed, false if not.

      • userBorrowing

        private static boolean userBorrowing(java.lang.String username)
                              throws java.sql.SQLException
        Method that gets a user that is currently borrowing the resource.
        Parameters:
        username - The user name of the person we are checking.
        Returns:
        True if the given user has ever borrowed a resource, false if not.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If the data base connection fails.
